intro: Jacksonia odontoclada, commonly known as the toothed broom. It is a flowering plant native to New Zealand, belonging to the daisy family (Asteraceae). The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. Jacksonia odontoclada is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
